page.title: 01DOUNBY GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: Most of our area was originally heather and marshland, but because of failed efforts by conservationists it is now mainly cultivated{farmland.}In the higher, more remote areas peat cutting is very popular amongst locals. This area is also widely used by{birds}for nesting. Land that is cultivated is mainly grassland. Houses are fairly scattered around our area except for those in{Dounby village which have been mainly built around a crossroads. One of the most popular places in Dounby would probably be the pub, called the Smithfield, because people go there for a pint and a yarn. {Farming}is the main occupation of the area. Others are employed in local trades and businesses. However, a large number of people in the Dounby area commute to jobs in other places.
